main_definition: Thomas is a common English name, but also an idiomatic expression that can have multiple meanings depending on the context.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A surname or given name of Hebrew origin meaning 'tender' or 'manly', derived from Tho'miah, a variant of Thoma
meanings_and_examples.example: Thomas Edison was an American inventor with the first name Thomas.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used to describe a clumsy or accident-prone person.
meanings_and_examples.example: Tommy always seems to be tripping over his own feet, he's quite a thomas!

meanings_and_examples.definition: A nickname given to someone as Thomas the Apostle, who was one of Jesus Christ's Twelve Disciples and is considered the patron saint of travelers.
meanings_and_examples.example: St. Christopher or Thomas the Protector is often invoked by people embarking on long journeys.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A playful way to refer to someone as a child, derived from 'Tommy' which was once used to describe young boys.
meanings_and_examples.example: Hey Tommy, give your old man a hand!
